title: How to Make a Melted Crayon Canvas

steps.headline: First, find your supplies.
steps.description: (List of supplies below) Make sure that you are working in an area that you don't mind getting dirty.

steps.headline: Glue crayons onto the top of your canvas in rainbow order.
steps.description: Let the glue dry. This might take up to an hour.

steps.headline: When your glue is dry, place your canvas against a wall so it's easier to make the melted wax drip downwards.
Take your hair-dryer, turn it on it's highest setting, and blow-dry the crayons.
steps.description: The heat from the blow-dryer will make the wax drip down the canvas. This may take awhile.

steps.headline: Once you're satisfied with your canvas, let the wax dry.
steps.description: It won't take too long. Hang up your masterpiece in a place where everybody will see it!
